text: what makes the most ambitious and
capable executive teams different than
the rest according to one of our authors
a psychologist who's worked with these
teams for over 20 years there are a few
standout qualities that make what she
calls genius teams genius as you might
expect some of the qualities are obvious
like their members are smart great
communicators and super adaptable but
one thing that's less obvious and
equally important is that they love a
good fight
benevolent friction conflict imp
patience call it what you want but the
best teams thrive on it and it kind of
makes sense because their job is to
improve on ideas and that requires
challenging each other and not
necessarily agreeing on everything at
the same time it's a slippery slope
because if that tension isn't managed
properly it can be pretty damaging
feelings get hurt reputations get
damaged and people get burned out to
avoid that these teams need clear roles
of Engagement and to set and respect
boundaries members might want to
constantly check in with each other or
use humor to diffuse tense situations if
I could put this all into a summary it
would be that genius teams really
understand the art of a good fight and
they know how to recover from it and now
I'm curious how does all of this sound
to you have you ever worked on a genius
team or would you knowing this
information
